intro: Lapeirousia corymbosa subsp. alta, commonly known as the mountain gladiolus, is a flowering plant native to the Cape Province of South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and striking, showy flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its higher elevation habitat compared to other subspecies of Lapeirousia corymbosa. Its flowers typically bloom in shades of pink, purple, and white, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. This plant is often found in rocky outcrops and is adapted to the cooler, more temperate climates of its native region.
